section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit:
Science|Business is a media and communications company focused on research and innovation in Europe.  Its activities include: 
 
1. The Science|Business Network contributes to the debate for Europe’s research and innovation policy through original thought leadership, research and executive meetings. It links leading European technology universities (incl. NTNU, ETH Zurich, Karolinska, Bologna, Aalto), multinationals (incl. Microsoft, Sanofi, Toyota, Total) and public-sector organisations (incl. Innovate UK, COST, Business Finland, CERN) - bringing together industry, research and policy. 
 
For more information: 
https://sciencebusiness.net/network 
 
2. Science|Business news is a free online news service focused on EU research and innovation with 19,000 registrants across the EU and internationally.  
 
For more information: 
http://www.sciencebusiness.net 
 
3. Science|Business consulting provides communication services to network members and other clients. These services include sponsored events, special reports, and communication strategies within the European innovation community.  
 
For more information: 
http://www.sciencebusiness.net/
relevant_communication:
Science|Business events and reports often provide a platform for members and clients to present their views on EU and member state innovation policies, as well as opportunities to network and gather information. This can include efforts by members or sponsors to indirectly influence the EU policy making process, as at any conference or in any publication. In this sense, Science|Business joins the Transparency Register as an "interest-related media or research organisation linked to private profit-making interests", due to the private-sector companies among its members, and as described in the Transparency Register Implementing Guidelines.  
 
Science|Business does not on its own behalf, or on behalf of its members, attempt to directly influence EU policy making or implementation. Our goal is to improve the climate for research and innovation in Europe through better communications among all parties, private and public.
